title.value: Inferring multiple consensus trees and supertrees using clustering: a review
title.justification: This is the title of the paper as provided.
title.quote: Inferring multiple consensus trees and supertrees using clustering: a review

extractions.description: This paper reviews recent advances and methods in the field of phylogenetic tree clustering. It discusses the methods' mathematical properties and describes the main advantages and limitations of multiple consensus tree and supertree approaches. The paper also illustrates the application of these methods to cluster aaRS gene trees according to their evolutionary patterns.

type.justification: The paper primarily reviews existing methods, mathematical properties, and their applications in clustering phylogenetic trees. It does not present new empirical data or experiments but focuses on theoretical aspects and algorithmic approaches.
type.quote: We critically review recent advances and methods in the field of phylogenetic tree clustering, discuss the methodsâ€™ mathematical properties, and describe the main advantages and limitations of multiple consensus tree and supertree approaches.

name.justification: The paper deals with modeling and analyzing phylogenetic trees, which are used to represent species evolution.
name.quote: Phylogenetic trees (i.e. evolutionary trees, additive trees or X-trees) play a key role in the processes of modeling and representing species evolution.

name.justification: The paper focuses on clustering algorithms such as k-means and k-medoids for phylogenetic tree clustering.
name.quote: The objective of partitioning is to find groups of similar elements according to a given similarity measure. The four main partitioning approaches that can be used to group the elements based on the set of their features (or variables) are the following: 1) a center of gravity, i.e., the k-means algorithm...

name.justification: The methods reviewed include various machine learning algorithms for clustering phylogenetic trees.
name.quote: Many approaches have been developed to provide solutions for classifying phylogenetic trees based on the well-known clustering algorithms, such as k-means and k-medoids.

name.justification: The context and applications discussed in the paper include the evolutionary history of species and genes, which is a fundamental topic in evolutionary biology.
name.quote: Consensus trees and supertrees have been widely used in evolutionary studies to combine phylogenetic information contained in individual gene trees.

name.justification: The paper discusses computational methods and algorithms for analyzing evolutionary data, which is a key aspect of bioinformatics.
name.quote: The resolution of multiple consensus trees and supertrees is generally much better than that of single consensus trees or supertrees inferred by conventional methods.

name.justification: The dataset consists of 36 aaRS phylogenetic trees used to demonstrate the application of multiple consensus tree clustering approaches.
name.quote: In our study, we used 36 aaRS phylogenetic trees (i.e. aaRS gene trees) originally constructed by Woese et al.

referenced_paper_title.value: Aminoacyl-tRNA synthetases, the genetic code, and the evolutionary process
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the title of the primary reference paper for the aaRS phylogenetic trees used in the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Woese et al. examined the evolutionary profiles of each of the 20 standard aaRSs used by living cells to construct the evolutionary history of proteins organized into 5 groups...
